contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Niclas Sahlgren.jpg|thumb|Niclas Sahlgren]] '''Niclas Sahlgren''' (in full '''Nicolaus Sahlgren''') (18 March 1701 – 10 March 1776), was a [[Swedish people|Swedish]] merchant and [[philanthropy|philanthropist]]. Born into a wealthy merchant family in [[Gothenburg]], Sahlgren was sent at the age of 16 as an apprentice to the [[Tietzen & Schröder]] trading house in [[Amsterdam]], where he learned languages and other aspects of trade. Several additional years of travels on the European continent, to England, and in Sweden, gained him experience, knowledge of natural resources and important contacts. He settled in Gothenburg again on the death of his mother and became a burgess of Gothenburg in 1733. He was one of the founders of the [[Swedish East India Company]] and one of its directors from 1733 to 1768. A large part of his wealth, left for the creation of a benefactory institution of some kind, was used to found a hospital named after Sahlgren in Gothenburg, the present [[Sahlgrenska University Hospital]]. In 1773, Sahlgren was elected a member of the [[Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]]. ==References== *Niklas Stenlås, "Sahlgren, Nicolaus (Niclas)", ''Svenskt biografiskt lexikon'', vol. 31, p. 241ff. {{Authority control|VIAF=41397819}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sahlgren, Niclas | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swedish businessman | DATE OF BIRTH = 18 March 1701 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 10 March 1776 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sahlgren, Niclas}} [[Category:18th-century Swedish people]] [[Category:Swedish merchants]] [[Category:1701 births]] [[Category:1776 deaths]] [[Category:People from Gothenburg]] [[Category:Members of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Swedish philanthropists]] [[Category:People associated with the Swedish East India Company]]
